page.title: 20SCHOOLS
page.content: Chilldren working on this project all attend one of 6 local primary schools. The buildings and layout vary greatly. {Wyborne School} was built in 1881 and was originally called Pope Street School. {Mottingham and Middle Park Schools} are large brick buildings built in the 1930's. {Horn Park} was built in 1949. The first permanent school opened in London after World War II. Newspapers called it "Super Modern" or "The Sunshine School". {Redhill} was built in the 1950's and is a light airy low building in spacious grounds. Nevertheless when children write about their school day the time table and cirriculum sound very similar whatever the type of building.
